DataElement.preferredName: Chronic Graft Versus Host Disease Patient Self-Report Main Eye Problem Score
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric value to represent self-reported severity of eye symptoms for an individual with chronic Graft vs. Host Disease (GVHD) using a ten (10) point scale (with '0' being not at all severe to '10' being most severe).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Chronic Graft Versus Host Disease Patient Self-Report Main Eye Problem
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A syndrome of immologically mediated tissue damage occurring following allogeneic transplant and may affect multiple organs with manifestations similar to autoimmune diseases.  Onset is usually within three years of transplantation or immunologic manipulation._Report coming directly from patients or subjects through interviews or self-completed questionnaires or other data capture tools such as diaries about their life, health condition(s) and treatment. NOTE: PROs are used to assess outcomes involving the patients'/subjects' perceptions, symptoms, satisfaction with treatment, adherence to prescribed regimens. PROs include outcomes recorded by interviewers transcribing the views expressed by the patient, but the term does not apply to outcomes recorded by observers who rely on their own judgment. A PRO is usually distinguished from a self-reported objective measurement such as a PEF score or body weight [from PRO Draft Guidance, Gordon Guyatt and Holger Schuneman - personal communication; Patrick, D.L., 2003. After Acquardo C., Berzon C., et al., 2001] See also outcome, subject, patient._Most important; principal._The organ of sight or vision._A difficulty, disorder, or condition needing resolution.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A graft versus host disease with symptoms appearing more than 100 days post-transplant.

Concepts.definition: A syndrome of immunologically mediated tissue damage that may occur following an allogeneic transplant, and may affect multiple organs with manifestations similar to autoimmune diseases. The onset is usually within three years of transplantation or immunologic manipulation.

Property.preferredDefinition: Subjective reports made by the patient:Most important; principal.:The organ of sight or vision. (On-line Medical Dictionary):Problem; a state of difficulty that needs to be resolved.

Concepts.definition: Subjective reports made by a patient.
The organ of sight or vision.
A difficulty, disorder, or condition needing resolution.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

NOTE: PROs are used to assess outcomes involving the patients'/subjects' perceptions, symptoms, satisfaction with treatment, adherence to prescribed regimens. PROs include outcomes recorded by interviewers transcribing the views expressed by the patient, but the term does not apply to outcomes recorded by observers who rely on their own judgment. A PRO is usually distinguished from a self-reported objective measurement such as a PEF score or body weight [from PRO Draft Guidance, Gordon Guyatt and Holger Schuneman - personal communication; Patrick, D.L., 2003. After Acquardo C., Berzon C., et al., 2001] See also outcome, subject, patient._Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Subjective reports made by the patient:An indication that a person has a condition or disease.  Some examples of symptoms are headache, fever, fatigue, nausea, vomiting, and pain.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.

DataElement.changeDescription: Curated to support CCR Transplant study 08C0097.
